noun.description: An award or privilege granted as a special honor or as an acknowledgment of merit.
examples: the ultimate official accolade of a visit by the president

noun.description: A touch on a person's shoulders with a sword at the bestowing of a knighthood.

origin: Early 17th century: from French, from Provençal acolada, literally embrace around the neck (when bestowing knighthood), from Latin ad- at, to + collum neck.
